    • Method Detail

      • getFreightCharge

        public java.lang.String getFreightCharge(com.yantra.shared.ycp.YFSContext ctx,
                                         java.lang.String inXML)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException
        Description copied from interface: YCSGetFreightChargeUserExit
        This user exit is called by the getFreightCharge API . To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.

        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Precondition:
        This user exit is called unconditionally.

        Postcondition:
        The user exit will throw appropriate exception if it does not want calculate the freight charges.

        NOTE: This user exit can be used to override Connection Parameters for Pierbridge Adaptor.


        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No.

        Specified by:
        getFreightCharge in interface YCSGetFreightChargeUserExit
        Parameters:
        ctx - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML that contains a sufficient amount of data to calculate the freight charges as required by getFreightCharge API. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

      • shipCarton

        public java.lang.String shipCarton(com.yantra.shared.ycp.YFSContext ctx,
                                   java.lang.String inXML)
                            throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException
        Description copied from interface: YCSshipCartonUserExit

        The shipCarton method of YCSshipCartonUserExit user exit is called by the addContainerToManifest API before manifesting a carton using carrier server. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit method for modifying the input XML. Input of this method is same as input XML prepared by Delivery and sent to YCS. Output of this method is used as input for executing the rest of shipCarton method. New attributes can be added to the output. Output XML is also expected to be similar to input XML. However, user is free to modify it to which ever structure he wants to and use YCS_PLD_Detail to map it to appropriate Carrier server specific XML.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API.


        NOTE: This user exit can be used to override Connection Parameters for Pierbridge Adaptor.


        Specified by:
        shipCarton in interface YCSshipCartonUserExit
        Parameters:
        ctx - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML document containing input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API on YCS. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.


      • shipCartonContinue

        public boolean shipCartonContinue(com.yantra.shared.ycp.YFSContext ctx,
                                  java.lang.String s)
                           throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException
        Description copied from interface: YCSshipCartonUserExit

        The shipCartonContinue method of YCSshipCartonUserExit user exit is called by the addContainerToManifest API before manifesting a carton using carrier server. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit for deciding whether the rest of shipCarton YCS method that calls appropriate carrier servers (FEDX/AIRB/UPS) should be executed or not. Input XML of this API is the output returned by shipCarton method of this user exit.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API.


        Specified by:
        shipCartonContinue in interface YCSshipCartonUserExit
        Parameters:
        ctx - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        s - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        boolean. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.


      • shipCartonOutXML

        public java.lang.String shipCartonOutXML(com.yantra.shared.ycp.YFSContext ctx,
                                         java.lang.String s)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException
        Description copied from interface: YCSshipCartonUserExit

        The shipCartonOutXML method of YCSshipCartonUserExit user exit is called by the addContainerToManifest API before manifesting a carton using carrier server. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit to manipulate data obtained from other systems and provide a standard input XML. If rest of the shipCarton YCS method should not be executed (shipCartonContinue returns false), then this method is used to return an output that would contain the Tracking#, Freight Charges etc. Input XML of this API is the output returned by shipCarton method of this user exit. And output XML should be similar to output returned by YCS back to Delivery.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This method is called conditionally (shipContinueCarton returns false).

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API.


        NOTE: This user exit can be used to override Connection Parameters for Pierbridge Adaptor.


        Specified by:
        shipCartonOutXML in interface YCSshipCartonUserExit
        Parameters:
        ctx - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        s - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML document containing input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API on YCS. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.

      • closeManifest

        public java.lang.String closeManifest(com.yantra.shared.ycp.YFSContext ctx,
                                      java.lang.String inXML)
                               throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException
        Description copied from interface: YCScloseManifestUserExit

        The closeManifest method of YCScloseManifestUserExit user exit is called by the closeManifest API before closing manifest on the YCS side. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit method for closing the manifest on YCS side. Input of this method is same as that of input XML of closeManifest API. Output of this method is same as output XML of closeMainfest API.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called conditionally only when closeManifestContinue method returns false.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain output XML data as required by the closeManifest API.


        NOTE: This user exit can be used to override Connection Parameters for Pierbridge Adaptor.


        Specified by:
        closeManifest in interface YCScloseManifestUserExit
        Parameters:
        ctx - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML document containing input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API on YCS. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.


      • closeManifestContinue

        public boolean closeManifestContinue(com.yantra.shared.ycp.YFSContext ctx,
                                     java.lang.String s)
                              throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException
        Description copied from interface: YCScloseManifestUserExit

        The closeManifestContinue method of YCScloseManifestUserExit user exit is called by the closeManifest API before closing manifest on the YCS side. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit for deciding whether the rest of YCS closeManifest method that calls appropriate carrier servers (FEDX/AIRB/UPS) should be executed or not. Input of this method is same as input XML as that of closeManifest API.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD

        s - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        boolean. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.

      • getReturnShippingLabel

        public java.lang.String getReturnShippingLabel(com.yantra.shared.ycp.YFSContext ctx,
                                               java.lang.String inXML)
                                        throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException
        Description copied from interface: YCSreturnShippingLabelUserExit

        The getReturnShippingLabel method of YCSreturnShippingLabelUserExit user exit is called by the addContainerToManifest API, before manifesting a carton using carrier server, only if the carton requires Return Shipping Label. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit method for modifying the input XML for Return Shipping Label. Also, the process of generating the Return Label can be implemented inside the method itself. Input to this method consist of all information related to Return Shipping Label passed from Delivery to YCS. Output of this method is used as input for executing the rest of the process of generating Return Shipping Label. New attributes can be added to the output but any change in the value of field Carrier is ignored if the method returnShippingLabelContinue of this UE returns true. Output XML is also expected to be similar to input XML. However, user is free to modify it to which ever structure he wants to and use YCS_PLD_Detail to map it to appropriate Carrier server specific XML.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called only when the carton being manifested requires Return Shipping Label.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API.


        NOTE: This user exit can be used to override Connection Parameters for Pierbridge Adaptor.


        Specified by:
        getReturnShippingLabel in interface YCSreturnShippingLabelUserExit
        Parameters:
        ctx - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML document containing input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API on YCS. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.


      • returnShippingLabelContinue

        public boolean returnShippingLabelContinue(com.yantra.shared.ycp.YFSContext ctx,
                                           java.lang.String inXML)
                                    throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException
        Description copied from interface: YCSreturnShippingLabelUserExit

        The returnShippingLabelContinue method of YCSreturnShippingLabelUserExit user exit is called by the addContainerToManifest API before manifesting a carton using carrier server. If you are extending the system for Return Shipping Label you can use this user exit for deciding whether the rest of shipCarton YCS method that calls appropriate carrier servers (FEDX) for generating Return Shiping Label should be executed or not. Input XML of this API is the output returned by getReturnShippingLabel method of this user exit.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents

        Precondition:
        This user exit is called unconditionally.

        The user exit will throw appropriate exception.
